Detailed Description

This provides a number of optional tools for working with a phys::World.

Currently this allows for more seamless mouse use, including 'picking' of objects with the mouse, and associated functionality.

Definition at line 57 of file worldquerytool.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phys::WorldQueryTool::WorldQueryTool ( World *  GameWorld_  ) 

Basic Constructor.

This creates a WorldQueryTool Ready to run queries on the the world you pass it.

Parameters:
GameWorld_ This is a pointer to the phys::World to be queried

Member Function Documentation

void phys::WorldQueryTool::GatherEvents ( bool  ClearEventsFromEventMgr = false  ) 

This gathers any user-input/event data that might be queryed.

This should be called periodcally (ideally in the post user input callback) to allow this to gather data from the phys::World 's event manager. When called this will drop prior event data and any relevant queries will come from this new data. At the caller's discretion this method can properly delete any events pulled from the event manager

Parameters:
ClearEventsFromEventMgr If set to true, This method will properly remove any events it pulls from the event manager.
